title: 8-10-23 Senate Study Committee on Occupational Licensing
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia 8-10-23 Senate Study Committee on Occupational Licensing session:

## Overview
This session focused on workforce needs and challenges in Georgia, as well as the state's occupational licensing framework. Key discussions centered around the need to modernize and streamline licensing processes to address workforce shortages across various industries.

## Key Actions
**SB 157**: No specific action on this bill was mentioned in the transcript.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No new bills were introduced during this session.

## Notable Moments
- Wanda Jaffee, Deputy Director of the Professional Licensing Board, provided an overview of the board's operations and efforts to quickly license Georgians.
- Daniello Perry, Vice President of the Georgia Chamber Foundation, presented data on Georgia's economic growth, job market, and workforce challenges.

## Votes
No recorded votes were mentioned in the transcript.

## Attendance
The session had a quorum, with Senators Bryan Strickland, Mike Dugan, and Anivatarty (virtually) in attendance. Senator Halpern had a prior commitment.

## Adjournment
The transcript did not provide information on when the session was adjourned or the date of the next session.
